physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Negative Gram stain with fewer than five white blood cells per high-powered field observed intraoperatively.
Thirteen months after total elbow arthroplasty, radiographs showed loosening about the ulnar component. The humeral component appeared to be well-fixed.

physical_examinations.date: Five months after cement spacer removal
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient presented with one-week history of fever, malaise, diffuse pain, and cloudy fluid draining from a sinus tract.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Intraoperative cultures from joint fluid grew methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus.
The patient had developed a flail elbow requiring support in a hinged brace.
